short: Sort history by most-used order in Omnibar
description: Controls the sorting order of history items displayed in the Omnibar search results. When enabled (true), history items are sorted by visit count (most used first). When disabled (false), history items are sorted by last visit time (most recent first). This setting affects the order of suggestions when opening the Omnibar with history mode, allowing users to choose between accessing frequently-visited sites or recently-visited sites.
valueDescription: Boolean flag to control history sorting order: true for most-used (visitCount), false for most-recent (lastVisitTime)

notes: This is a UI preference setting that controls how the Omnibar presents history items. The setting is toggled by pressing the 'reset' key (typically Escape) while browsing history results in the Omnibar. The toggle happens in the onReset handler, allowing users to quickly switch between the two sorting strategies during an Omnibar session. The setting persists across sessions and affects all subsequent history queries in the Omnibar. Similar to tabsMRUOrder which controls tab sorting behavior.
